findings.title: Missing logic to check `msg.value` in the `mint()` and `collect()` functions
findings.description: When users choose to pay with native tokens, there is no check to verify how many native tokens they provide or if it matches the specified `price`. If there are native tokens available in the contract, attackers can potentially use them for distribution.

findings.title: Unprotected Payment Token Duplication
findings.description: The `setPaymentToken()` function does not verify whether the address passed into it exists or not, allowing admin to add a duplicated address and modify data within `paymentTokens`.

findings.title: Consider adding the `cancelCollect()` function
findings.description: Should also consider adding the `cancelCollect()` function to allow the owner to change the price or stop `collect()` by blacklisting the old signature (add a nonce field to the `CollectData` struct and blacklist the message hash).

findings.title: `epochsState.unlocked` has not been updated in the `_unlock()` function
findings.description: The value of `epochsState.unlocked` variable is not updated when an epoch is completely unlocked.
